inn1.comm: cuts back into McCullum and raps him on the pad but fairly high and going down leg
left alone outside off stump
interesting from McCullum, advances down the track and to leg but Shafiul pushes it wide off stump, McCullum forced to leave and retreat into his crease
caught behind!! seamed away outside off and McCullum pushed at it, healthy edge through to the keeper and New Zealand's best batsman from the first game is gone for a duck!!
accurate line, on the stumps and Watling moves his back leg across to defend
on the pads and nicely flicked away to the midwicket boundary where the fielder cannot reach it
on the leg stump, hits Ryder high on the pad, appeal but not out
defended to mid-off
pulled away to deep backward square
short on the stumps, Watling defends into the pitch and thinks about a single but no run there
mistimes a drive back to the bowler
very very wide outside off stump, left alone and with good reason
punches to mid-off
half-tracker on leg stump, Ryder sits back and picks it up with ease over square leg for a wonderful six
pushed back to the bowler although the ball was of similar length
Shafiul continues to put it on Ryder's pads, tucked away into the vacant midwicket area
better line, defended
wider of off this time, Ryder middles it straight to cover, disappointed with himslef, the right placement would have earned him four
on middle stump, Ryder works it to mid-on
defended into the covers showing the full face of the blade
this time defends the slight in-swing to mid-on
short outside off, Watling punches off the back foot through cover
on the pads and Ryder delightfully flicks away but committed fielding keeps him to two
again fired way wide of off stump, Ryder had no chance of reaching that
worked to short midwicket
on off stump, pushes to mid-off
defends on the front foot into the covers
swings away outside off, Watling chop drives through backward point to the fielder in the deep
Laxmanesque from Ryder, flips the wrists and works from outside off out to deep square leg
defends to the leg side
well played, tucks into the leg side with soft hands, quick single scampered
beautiful, slightly short but driven on the up through the covers, the fielders made no attempt to chase after that
flighted on off, defends in textbook fashion
on leg stump and flicked away to deep midwicket
Ryder works Razzak, over the wicket to the left hander, away to deep square
defends to off
inside edges into his pads attempting to defend
chopped away into the covers with little timing
pushes into the covers
goes for the swivel pull but misses as the ball whizzes past off stump
flicked away into the leg side
defended by Watling back down the pitch
off the back foot, hit straight to cover
lovely square drive to a slightly short ball outside off stump, threads the gap and comfortably beats deep third man
appeal for lbw, may have struck Ryder outside off after he missed the sweep
worked away to long-on
defends Razzak from around the wicket to leg
charges down and swings slightly wildly past midwicket, may have got a hand to that but hard to call that a chance
gets the leading edge to point trying to work to midwicket
jams out a fast yorker
identical to his first six, picks up and deposits over square leg
defends this time to off
slower ball but on the pads, uses the wrists to work wide of mid-on
shortish on off, slight bounce but Watling adjusts and punches to mid-on
outside off, Watling tries to drive but mistimed as he was not quite to the pitch of that
comes down and mistimes the loft over mid-off but clears the fielder's head with relative ease
sweeps powerfully to deep square
defends nervously to point
that one stopped on Watling whose defensive stroke popped up to where a silly mid-on may have been
drives to long-off
driven away on the off side
sweeps to fine leg
swept into the ground out to the fielder patrolling the deep square-leg boundary
pulled away off the back foot to bring up New Zealand's 50, which is also the 50 partnership incidentally
sweeps straight to fine leg, Watling comes halfway down but the fielder fumbles allowing Watling to safely return with no harm done
appeal for caught behind, Ryder missed the sweep after coming down the track, hit the top of the pad
flicked away past a diving short midwicket
inside edges to leg
mistimed the drive completely, chopped into the ground
gets the single this time down to long-off
shows the full face and taps it down to long-on
pulls away into the leg side
caught! Came down the track and tried to deposit over long-on, but hits high with no distance where Junaid settles safely underneath it at midwicket
oh dear, Taylor almost run out without facing a ball, similar to Watling's near run-out except that the fielder fired a throw back but just wide with Taylor struggling
outside leg, Taylor helps it on its way to get underway
inside edged to fine leg
big blow for New Zealand! Ryder goes for the slog sweep but it settles in Imrul's hands a couple of steps in front of the boundary, Ryder goes after looking good
flicked to leg
misses the ball down leg, no wide called so possibly some pad on that
digs out a ball fired into off stump
clips off his toes with little power
check drive down to long-off
gets on the front foot but transfers his weight onto the back foot and cuts to point
on leg stump, Taylor defends with the full face to midwicket
lovely stroke from Taylor, arm ball fired in, he quickly rocked back and sliced it past the fielder
yorker on off, pushed out
drives to cover
on leg stump but worked straight to the fieldsman
ooh, inside edges the attempted drive past leg stump, lucky escape for Elliott
again pushed out to cover
worked to midwicket where a misfield allows to Elliott to retain strike for the next over and prevent a maiden
well bowled, Elliott reaches out to defend to the off side
fired into leg, he drives inside out to cover

gone!! Brilliant from Shakib, slightly shorter on middle, Elliott groped but couldn't reach it and watched helplessly as it spun past his attempted forward defensive and crashed into off stump. New Zealand staring down the barrel
pushes back to the bowler
spins back in but Vettori confidently leaves alone outside off
Vettori off the mark with a sweep out to deep midwicket, it was quite wide so Vettori had to fully extend his arms to reach that
Vettori cuts dangerously past the lone slip down to the third man boundary where the fielder keeps it to three
on middle and leg, worked with the turn to midwicket
outside off this time and blocked into the ground
short and down leg, wide given as Taylor missed an attempted pull
goes back and nicely punches to long-on
swept from outside off but straight to fine leg
tight call! Vettori hit it into the covers and set off, Taylor looked to be struggling but somehow beats the throw to the keeper. Replays show that he was relatively comfortable
paddle sweeps fine
no-ball giving Taylor a free hit which you just don't give. Replays show the foot may have been behind the line
slogs to mid-on who drops it but it doesn't matter as this is a free hit, a run taken
digs out to long-off
squeezed out to long-off
comes down and works to the left of square leg
down leg but Taylor does not get it past fine leg
nice delivery on off stump which Taylor respects with a forward defensive into the leg side
worked away off the pads
punches a drive back to the bowler
this time goes on the back foot and defends a ball on off
Shafiul escapes with a ball on Taylor's pads which is sweetly flicked but perfectly into the hands of midwicket
punched past Shafiul but only as far as mid-off
goes back and pulls through midwicket, not that well timed but that allows them to come back for a couple

OUT!!! That is a loss of gigantic proportions for New Zealand as their skipper departs! Tame end as he gets a leading edge straight back to the bowler trying to flick into the leg side. Vettori unable to rescue his side today, New Zealand slide further into the mire
goes back and drives nicely but straight to cover
appeal for lbw, a hint of inside edge while the umpire says it hit him outside the line of off
on middle and straightens, Stewart hurriedly defends
on leg stump and going down, hits him on the pad as he looks to defend
tossed up but Taylor doesn't fall for the bait, played into the off side
lovely from Shakib, short on off and spinning past Taylor who may have been adopting the curtain rail leave
worked off the pads to midwicket
on middle and check drives back to the bowler
maiden over, a rarity for Taylor to be the batsman, goes back and defends to cover
down leg, Stewart gets a faint edge into his pad while sweeping which balloons over slip as they take a single
blocked down the pitch
nudges to fine leg
well down leg side, Taylor reaches out and flicks out deep, a definite wide had he left it
defends to mid-on
flicks to midwicket
digs out to deep cover
defends into the off side
sweeps fine for a couple
inside edges the defensive stroke into the leg side, Taylor is alert to the quick single
tentatively defended
driven to cover
cramped for room, squeezed to cover again
punched off the back foot back to Suhrawadi
pushed to the left of the bowler who gets a hand to it but cannot prevent the single
another dot ball to finish, defends
well swept to the deep backward square leg boundary, first boundary for a considerable period
poor line from Razzak, down leg, this time the paddle sweep produces only a single, good diving save by the fielder at fine leg
well played by Taylor, softly defended into the off side
slightly edgy as he works it to backward point where good running beats the throw at the striker's end
short and wide, but Stewart wastes the opportunity, slammed to cover
this time on middle, the sweep finds the fielder
punched off the back foot to long-off
tossed up on leg stump, Taylor deftly dabs into the leg side
short but on middle, the attempted pull becomes a cramped on-drive off the back foot
squeezed out to cover
rocks back and slashes the cut straight to point
again squeezed out behind square on the off side
defends back down the track
down leg, Taylor gets his bat around his front pad and works out to deep square
shorter on leg stump but Stewart can only work to mid-on
unconvincingly scratched out past cover
slung down on off stump, defends to mid-on
short but swings back in to Stewart, who adjusts well to play back down the pitch where a diving Rubel fields off his own bowling
punched through point off the back foot
short outside off, Taylor plays off the back foot to cover

appeal for lbw, Taylor survives. He comes down the track (only a couple of steps)and goes for his favourite leg-side heave, cuts back in from outside off to beat the heave, strikes him on the kneeroll and looked to be heading on towards middle and leg
driven to point
pushed against the turn to cover
absolutely plumb, on middle, straightens, Stewart's sweep is nowhere near the ball which cannons into his front pad. Bangladesh trampling all over New Zealand here

almost 2 dismissals there, McCullum walked way across his stumps and had to reach for the ball way outside leg which fell just short of midwicket. Meanwhile Taylor had come down looking for a single and had to race back just beating the throw
defends back to Suhrawadi who has bowled an excellent spell
comes down and skies it over the covers, 100 up for New Zealand
jammed out into the off side
on middle and leg, flicked to midwicket who fumbles but no chance of a run
good intent from Taylor, defends down the track and sets off for what eventuates into a comfortable single
down leg, hits Nathan on the pad

cleaned out. McCullum was thinking about swinging to leg, Rubel bowls it full on middle and McCullum tries to change his mind late which only produces a limp mixture of a defensive stroke and a leg-side hoick, which the ball beats as it goes straight through the gate
loud appeal for lbw as Mills is rapped on the pads, but going down leg, Rubel very energetic after his wicket
poor stroke from Mills, a 'windy woof' as Richie Benaud would say, swings back in from outside off and beats Mills' incoherent swish
bit of bounce as Taylor defends
walks across and defends straight
ditto the previous delivery
reaches out to work to leg
worked to backward point
defends to complete a maiden over, which presumably doesn't happen too often in the 34th over of an ODI. Suhrawadi has the Nadkarni-like figures of 3 for 11 in 9 overs.
Mills defends straight
short outside off, hammered away by Mills, good diving save at pointprevents four
punched to long-on
down leg, hits Mills on the back pad
comes back in from outside off, Mills squeezes it out to point
arm ball on middle, Taylor inside edges to leg
blocked to cover
premeditates a filthy swipe to deep midwicket from way outside off
outside off and spins away, Mills leaves
closer to the stumps, Mills drawn into defending
mixture of edge and open face as Mills comes forward to defend, ball trickles to backward point
Taylor waits and turns to square leg
full on middle, Mills shows the full face
goes back and inside edges the drive onto his pad, almost back onto the stumps
Mills has had enough of this dot-ball business. Gets down on one knee and powerfully slog sweeps over cow corner into the stands
appeal for lbw but sliding down leg
flays the cut off the back foot but straight to point, Mills looking to up the tempo
Taylor moves across and tries to whip through leg, clips his pad but Mushfiqur dives well to prevent four leg-byes
Taylor again advances and this time swipes it for a flat six through midwicket. New Zealand finally getting a move on
slower ball, Taylor repeats his swipe which evades the fielder at deep midwicket
more six-swiping here from Taylor, similar to the first six in the over. Superb over for New Zealand as Taylor ups his strike rate to 61
smart batting, waits on it and works it to long-on for a single
yorker which tails down leg, Mills clips off his toes to midwicket
the runs are flowing now, outside off and Taylor square drives past the despairing fielders to the cover fence
goes back and pulls on the bounce to the midwicket sweeper
Mills backs away and exposes all three stumps while hitting to the left of cover, allowing them to rush a single
Monstrous hit from Taylor, fierce slog sweep which sails over the heads of the boundary patrollers
worked to leg for a single allowing Taylor to retain the strike for the next over
goes across the stumps, fired down leg, reaches out to work the single which brings up an invaluable 50 for Ross Taylor, who has picked up the pace in the Powerplay
horrendous full toss outside off which Mills slams over the bowler's head for another six
and again! outside off, Mills lashes it over long-off for his third six
full on middle and leg, well worked into the vacant areas on the leg side for a couple
good comeback, yorker on middle and off, dug out
driven back to Shakib. Excellent over for New Zealand who have done especially well in targeting Shakib who is the lynchpin of the Bangladeshi lineup
down leg, goes for the swipe, hits the pad as Taylor misses
wristed to mid-on
fired into leg, Mills cannot get that away
chopped into the ground
moves outside leg, Suhrawadi follows him but Mills digs it out
dug out to mid-on. Tight single taken. End of a brilliant spell, 3 for 14 in the full allotment
Taylor moves outside off and swipes it brilliantly over midwicket, the onslaught continues
driven past Shakib, thinks about two but comes back and just beats the throw
free hit coming up as Shakib oversteps, Mills defends back in anticipation of the next delivery
full toss but Mills could only slice it on the bounce to point
cheeky paddle sweep having walked across and exposed all the stumps
finally respite for Bangladesh, Mills goes down on one knee and tries to hit over long-on, limited distance though as Rubel settles under the skier
Southee looks to defend, gets an outside edge which trickles to third man
punched to the bowler
goes for the sweep and misses, loud appeal for lbw but hit him outside the line

not so lucky this time! similar stroke except that this delivery hit him in front of middle and off, the umpire raised his finger immediately. New Zealand in danger of being bowled out after recovering in the Batting Powerplay

and speak of the devil, McKay feathers a ball outside off stump through to Mushfiqur who holds onto a sharp catch. New Zealand all out for 173, they will require a very disciplined bowling effort to keep Bangladesh at bay

inn2.comm: Full toss swinging into leg which is worked away nicely, to compound matters it is a no-ball. Free hit coming up
Nafees skies it up in the air but runs a single before Taylor takes an irrelevant catch.
on Kayes' pads and worked away again, poor start from Mills with New Zealand defending a low score
finally on middle, defended back down the pitch
throws the arms at it outside off and drills it straight to mid-off

dropped, but in reality it was a superlative effort. Kayes uppishly flicked it off the pads and Stewart at square leg jumped acrobatically to try and pluck it with one hand, he had it for a moment but it spilled as he was falling
defended back down the pitch to end a long over due to the break in play
outside off but full, dug out
lovely swing from Southee, on off and tempts the batsman into a forward defensive which is beaten as the ball moves away
faster than the second ball of the over but all else remains the same
aggressive from Kayes, off-drives Southee down the ground after having been beaten twice in the over
picked up and swung to the midwicket fence to make what was a good over for the Kiwis into a good over for bangladesh
slices the drive airily between cover and mid-off
short outside off, carved over point to perfection
left alone outside off. Frenetic start for Bangladesh who appear determined to bat positively before the lunch break
driven back to Mills from outside off
goes across the batsman, Nafees has nothing to do with it
wide of off, this time he goes for it and cuts in front of square where the McCullum brothers retrieve
driven back to the bowler
nervy defensive stroke away from the pads, inside edges into the pad and trickles to the off side
attempted sweep, ball rolls out to the leg side off the pad
well flighted, 77.6kph, full and dug out
driven to cover against the angle
sweeps hard out to deep backward square which prevents a maiden
half-volley outside off, driven away past cover to the fence beating Elliott's dive after he ran from mid-off
defends back down the pitch. Lunch is near, the openers would want to be not out when it arrives
works off leg stump to short midwicket
on the pads, goes back and gets struck, rolls to the same fielder
short and outside off, the aggressive intent is not being dulled by an impending lunch. Thrashed away through the covers
on the pads, works it around the corner to fine leg
on middle and leg, defended to the leg side
similar delivery, again played to leg
this time outside off, punched into the covers
moves away from Imrul who feels at it outside off
short on off but well defended by Imrul who went right back and played it into the ground
opens the face to a ball on off stump and plays to point, quiet start after lunch
flighted into middle stump, defended
similar delivery, again defended
this time goes onto the back foot and defends
fired in on middle stump but a well executed sweep sends the ball racing to the bacward square leg boundary
back to that middle stump line, defended to short midwicket
again sweeps off middle stump but this time only for a single
short on off, defends into the track
wide outside off and chopped to wide third man. A no-ball as well, another free hit coming up, they haven't been taken advantage of today
backs away and slices the slow full toss into the covers for one, a tight single in the end as you can still be run out off the free hit
more short-pitched bowling wide of off stump, carved away through backward point by Nafees
this time it's not short but a half-volley outside off which is creamed through the covers, 50 up for Bangladesh at more than a run-a-ball
left alone outside off
extra bounce outside off which surprises Nafees, fizzes over the top of his attempted slash
outside off, nicely turning away from the left-hander, left alone
sliced to short cover
defended into the off side with soft hands
short and wide outside off but Kayes mistimes the cut into the ground
down leg, appeared to hit the pad but given as off the bat
defends to short cover again
swings into off, defended into the covers
short and swings into his ribs, drops down on the pitch
short outside off, does well to cut but straight to the fielder
beautifully played, a stroke of real elegance, it swung in from outside off and Kayes responded with a lovely on-drive that teased Southee as it went to the fence
on middle and swings down leg past Kayes' attempted flick, wide given as Watling fumbles
mistimes the cover drive into the ground, limply rolls to cover
on off and again swings in, Kayes plays it down to short midwicket
around the wicket, worked to leg
very slow, flighted outside off, Kayes inside edges the attempted cut into his pad
defends a straighter ball on middle stump
sweeps powerfully out to deep backward square
repeats the shot but without the power, only the single this time
goes right back and, standing almost square-on, works into the gap at square leg
defends the inswinging delivery
short ball, tries to swing to leg but inside-edges on the bounce to Watling
hit on the pad down leg, thinks of a single but not there
again goes for the pull, beats the batsman and rebounds into the third man area off his body
slower ball outside off, defended into the covers
well played, cover driven all along the ground with impeccable timing
good comeback, drags the batsman wide and beats his defensive prod
leaves outside off
spins back in which results in the drive rolling back to Vettori
rocks back and, as Ranil Abeynaike would say, slashes and slashes hard outside off to the point fence
outside off, defends into the ground
outside off, no swing this time, forced to cover
off the back foot this time but again to cover
well down leg side, wide called, Watling again fumbles on the second bounce
slower ball outside off which keeps slightly low, crouches slightly and jabs to a busy cover fieldsman
slower ball but way outside off, Kayes reaches and chops to third man
one bouncer for the over, outside off and beats the attempted hook
slightly fuller outside off but similar tactic, attempted pull meets only thin air
on middle going towards off, misses the sweep but also missing off
possible escape for Kayes, pitched on middle and leg and turned back in, struck on the pad but limited appealing, looks to be hitting leg
outside off, swept straight to Nathan McCullum at deep backward square
outside off, defended to cover
not that short from Vettori but Nafees rocks back, gives himself room and sends it to the point boundary
plays down to mid-off
down leg, beats the attempted leg glance, rolls down to fine leg
short of a length outside off, driven on the up through the covers, 50 up for Nafees, well played, setting his team on the road to victory
pushes this fuller delivery into the cover region
short outside off, goes for the pull, does not get all of it but picks up a couple
wide down leg
pitches outside leg, worked square
shorter and on middle stump, nicely hops up and works into the ground for a single
defends to cover
pushes with soft hands into the covers for a quick single
on the pads, tucked to fine leg
down leg, goes for a hoick, goes through the batsman and Watling fumbles unsighted
worked to the off side
sweeps but picks out fine leg
gentle floater outside off, pushed to mid-off
slower ball but dragged shorter, dabbed fine of third man
way down leg, Watling dives well to prevent four wides and takes it cleanly
nice slower ball on off, defends back down the pitch
beats the attempted glide to third man
more bounce this time as the batsman is again beaten trying to work to the off side
fullish slower ball on leg stump, worked to mid-on
outside off, keeps low and beats the cut
comes down the track, not fully to the pitch and a bit away from the ball, but extends the arms and sends it over the cover fielder's head
worked to fine leg
short and worked off the back foot to long-off
angled into middle stump, works it dangerously off that position out to deep square
similar stroke but this time worked behind square for the same result
on middle and punched back to Ryder
slower ball but short on leg stump, whirls it fine to bring up the 100 for Bangladesh. Also the 100 opening partnership which has been an excellent effort
worked away behind square
drives to mid-on
slower ball, tries to work it for one but straight to short midwicket
very wide of off, Kayes really has to reach for it and gets it off the top half of the horizontal blade on the bounce to deep third man
on off turning away a touch, defended with soft hands
tossed up outside off, hammered but straight to mid-off
flighted down leg but the sweep picks out fine leg
too much flight, turns into a full toss which is meekly patted to mid-off
ah! innovation as he reverse-paddles it down to third man
easily punches to long-off
short slower ball which moves away from the left-hander, dabbed to third man
full on leg stump, squeezed to mid-on but with some timing
short on off, Nafees rocks back and pulls hard to the midwicket fence
full toss which Nafees swings at with all his might towards cow corner, umpires go upstairs to check if Kane Williamson, the 12th man, has saved the boundary and he has
slower ball on leg stump, simple pick-up and deposit over square leg, one bounce to the fence
down leg, a poor ball that is deservedly helped on its way to the fine leg boundary, New Zealand really falling apart here
pushed to mid-off
driven inside-out on the bounce to cover who misfields allowing the single
top edges the sweep on the bounce to deep backward square
worked off the back foot to deep point
punched to mid-on
goes back and tries to dab through third man but gets too much bat on it and it goes to backward point
outside off and goes on with the arm, beats the attempted cut
defends down the pitch
sweeps out to deep square, Southee runs round and collects
paddles it to fine leg
more sweep than paddle this time, rolls the wrists on it to keep it down, behind square for a single
top edges the sweep again, and again it flies just over and out of reach of the fine leg fielder. Sums up New Zealand's day today really
goes back and clips to deep square
finally!! comes down the track and gives himself a bit of room, drives inside out but straight to mid-off where Brendon McCullum gives his brother a wicket
digs out a ball on middle and leg
outside leg, and tucked fine
drives back to the bowler
down leg, tries to flick but gets hit on the pad, rolls straight to fine leg
flighted outside off, defended
on off and turns in quickly but Siddique is able to work it behind square
swept to deep backward square
clipped to midwicket
tossed up on leg, batsman waits and waits and eventually works square
again swept, a shot which has been employed repetitively today, out to the boundary rider at deep backward square
down leg, pokes it to fine leg
very full, goes for the drive which he almost jams back into his stumps
fifty for Kayes, works it into the off side with soft hands, good supporting role
reaches out and wrists it with the turn into the off side

gone!! in similar fashion to his opening partner, tried to loft the bowler inside out over extra cover but only got the elevation, the distance was lacking and the boundary rider came in to do the rest. Slight roadblock for Bangladesh as they march towards victory
full toss outside off, drilled to cover on the bounce, almost caught in fact
goes back and lashes through cover
comes forward to defend, bit more bounce and it hits the top of the bat handle
pushes to the off side
this time defends back down the pitch. Silly mid-off in place to put some pressure on the new batsman
again flighted on off, and agin played back to Vettori
defends to the leg side
almost a run-out, flicked widish of mid-on, easy single there but the non-striker sent Siddique back, who just beat the throw. Raqibul turned his back
defended
tucked to the leg side
digs out to long-off
outside off, well swept past Williamson at a wide fine leg to the fence
outside off, pushed away to the off to end Nathan's spell
short outside off but no turn back in forcing Siddique to reach, he can only chop it to point
waits for it and nicely dabs but straight to third man
whacked away into the covers
fired into leg stump, Raqibul jams it out
outside off, spun back in a fraction, kept low, Raqibul almost chopped it into his stumps, hits the ground and Watling's foot before going to slip
defends a full delivery on middle
gentle full toss, pushed to long-off
another horrendous full toss which is inexplicably patted to midwicket
dabbed to point
fired into leg stump, played to midwicket
again on leg, on-drives into the deep
gets Siddique to defend, not a bad little over there
on middle stump, pushed past silly mid-off
goes forward and then back to dab to point
drives the full ball well and runs straightaway, simple single in the end
nicely flicked by Siddique to long-on
goes back to work to the leg side, both batsmen think of a run but the fieldsmen are alert
same as the previous delivery but played with softer hands enabling the single
full face of the bat back to Ross
squeezed out
worked back to the bowler
played to point
flicked to square leg, game meandering here
full toss on leg stump, Raqibul works it to long-on to deny Taylor a maiden
rocks bat and cuts into the covers
checks the drive back to Vettori
lovely from Vettori, flighted on off, Raqibul waited and missed the cut as the ball spun just pas the off stump
pushed into the covers
Siddique works it into the narrow gap between point and cover
on leg, Raqibul's defensive stroke pops up into the leg side but they take a single with no fielders in the immediate vicinity, 150 up for Bangladesh
swung away from Raqibul who flirted at it with no foot movement
defends more solidly this time
defends into the off side
more of the same

drives into the off side, Vettori picks up and hits the stumps direct but Raqibul is safe. To add insult to injury they pick up an overthrow from the ricochet, a rule that Sunny Gavaskar believes should be removed
hit on the pads but going down the leg side, Bangladesh cruising along here
defends to leg
spins back sharply, adjusts and squeezes it away square on the leg side
worked into the vacant area at midwicket. No sign of the Batting Powerplay which would surely hasten the end
clipped past Vettori to long-on
outside off, no turn, left alone
on off, goes back to defend the last ball of another economical, but wicketless, Vettori spell
punched off the back foot to the bowler
short down leg side, pulled down to deep fine leg
punched to Brendon McCullum at cover
short outside off, controlled dab to third man
nice drive but cannot beat mid-off
on leg stump, wristy flip over midwicket and wide of square leg
horrible wide outside off, started outside the wide line and went further, off the pitch almost. Memories of Harmison and Brisbane come flooding back
short ball outside off, sits up but Siddique manages to slap it to a diving Nathan McCullum. Poor stroke and a poor delivery
full ball outside off carved along the ground to point
finally a semblance of intent to finish the Kiwis off, wide outside off and driven away nicely to the covers
open the dam and the flood begins. short ball outside off which comes in slightly, gets on top of it and cuts through backward point
pushed to point
outside off, very close to a wide, marginal call, left alone to end an average over which somehow earned a wicket
Mills strays onto the pads and is worked out to deep backward square
short ball, Shakib goes back and taps to mid-off, runs a quick single
short on middle, Raqibul plays it down safely
played back to Mills on the bounce, who deflects it to mid-off
on middle stump, Raqibul props forward and defends
driven wide of cover
defends into the off side
rears up slightly outside off, easily beats the attempted cut
worked off the pads to midwicket. McKay is round the wicket to the right-hander btw
played down towards point
slower ball outside off, mistimes the on-the-up drive through the covers for a couple. 2 to get
but not in this over, as Raqibul leaves alone outside off
a no-ball but no free hit because Shakib smoked the half-volley through the covers, great way to finish and fitting that their captain wins them the game
